column4: I typed in 'sudo apt-get...what's the correct parameter after that?
davenull...I obliterated my hd last night...so only Ubuntu 8.10 is on it
davenull...please give me a 'magic' text command lol :)
to install Audacity...it won't recognise the command...the exe file etc
sudo apt-get...and then how do I type the filenname?
Please bear with me easwar...but the pc I'm working on is not online...so updates are not possible...is that what you mean by update (an online update?)
si I can't install software of any kind without an internet connection?
you're on the internet now? right? other computer is not? where is the other computer?
it means that there is something that is trying to install a package somewhere else, or a package installation got interrupted and the lock file got left behind(stale lock file)
if your trying to use dpkg or apt-get/aptitude, make sure you don't have one of them running somewhere else too
i don't know that anything's wrong. what are you trying to do? if it's just update your system, then do...  sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade
if you get the same response... '0 upgraded 0 installed etc...   then your system is fully up to date
are you at the system with a package you want to install? a .deb package?
go to the directory containing the .deb package you want to install. then do -->   sudo dpkg -i <package_name>
what are you trying to do?
